text:
A Debts Recovery Tribunal here in Chennai has passed an interim injunction against four directors of Helios and Matheson Information Technology Limited, restraining their travel outside India.

The tribunal granted the injunction in view of a pending application moved by the State Bank of Travancore against the company headquartered in Chennai, for recovery of over Rs. 34 crore.

Moving an emergent petition on Monday, the bank pointed out an undertaking made by the directors of the company before the Supreme Court on September 24 stating that they would deposit Rs. 10 crore within four weeks and also discharge the remaining amount to the depositors in equal instalments within in a period of one year.

“But so far the company has not complied with the undertaking, which itself is self explanatory that its directors would flee the country at any point of time to defeat the possible orders of the tribunal,” counsel for the bank said.

The petitioner sought the tribunal to restrain the directors of the company G.K. Muralikrishna, V. Ramachandran, Annapurna Muralikrishna and R. Padmaja from travelling outside India, pending disposal of the recovery application.
title: 4 directors of Helios and Matheson restrained from travelling abroad
